column4: Most users can get by just fine without building anything from source, and 2) there are a few good package managers, 3) GUI is great, leaps and bounds ahead of XP and Vista.
My personal advice on the whole ndiswrapper debacle is simply avoid at all costs using hardware that sux-out-of-box.
So I should buy another laptop just because my Wireless isn't supported out of the box?
Companies generally don't "turn on a dime" to switch entire architectures.
